thread.title: Live: Hazlewood survives for first Test
thread.title_full: Live: Hazlewood survives for first Test

title: Live: Hazlewood survives for first Test
text:
Live coverage of Australia’s series-opening Test against India: blog, updates, scores and video February 23, 2017 1:07pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS AUSTRALIA’S biggest test of 2017 has arrived, with Border-Gavaskar trophy going on the line in a gruelling four-Test series starting in Pune. 
Indian antagonist Harbhajan Singh fired the biggest broadside at the tourists last week when he determined that should they play to their absolute peak, the best they could hope for would be to draw one of the four Tests. 
Steve Smith’s men have arrived in Pune without the confident bravado of previous tours, and with some inexperience in the batting lineup. 
Newcomers Matthew Renshaw (20) and Peter Handscomb (25) have just four Tests each under their belts, but are coming off successful summers after being introduced into the national team. 
Subcontinental specialist Shaun Marsh is expected to play a big role in the series, with Usman Khawaja the expected fall guy. 
Much has also been made about the make up of the bowling group, with the man whose name is on the trophy - champion Australian captain Allan Border - imploring his side to blast India out with pace. 
Border remains unconvinced by the spin qualities on offer, declaring Australia will not win with spin. 
Beating India on their home soil is no easy task, and there’s a reason why since 1969 only the 2004 tourists - who boasted all-time greats Ricky Ponting, Glenn McGrath, Shane Warne and Adam Gilchrist in its ranks - have triumphed.
